message: '{0}' is a type and cannot be imported in JavaScript files. Use '{1}' in a JSDoc type annotation.
suggestion: Convert TypeScript type imports to JSDoc type annotations in JavaScript files. Use @typedef or inline JSDoc comments instead of import statements for types.

example.base:
import { MyType } from './types'

const value = { name: 'test' }
example.description: Replace type import with JSDoc typedef

example.base:
import { User, Product } from './types'

function processUser(user) { }
example.description: Replace multiple type imports with JSDoc typedefs
